task_summary: The robot is instructed to open the cabinet door, which is performed by perceiving the door, approaching and aligning to it, performing the opening action, verifying the door is open, and retreating. Visual evidence is used to structure and confirm the necessary behavioral steps.

task_long_description.overview: This episode captures a robot tasked with opening the cabinet door above a kitchen sink area. The scene includes a white cabinet door, robotic arm, and countertop. The robot performs perception, localization, alignment, actuation to open the door, verification of success, and a retreat movement. Task constraints include visual confirmation and careful approach to avoid collision; no objects are grasped or manipulated besides the cabinet door itself.
preconditions: Robot is positioned in front of cabinet
Cabinet door is closed at start
stepwise_plan: Check if cabinet door is visible
If not visible, scan for cabinet door up to 3 times
Detect precise location of the cabinet door
Approach and align with the cabinet door
Perform opening of the cabinet door using safe force/time parameters
Verify if cabinet door is open
Retreat arm to a safe position
success_criteria: Cabinet door is open beyond initial position
failure_and_recovery: Failure: Cabinet door not detected – recovery: scan up to 3 times
Failure: Opening incomplete – recovery: retry approach
Failure: Unexpected obstruction – recovery: abort and retreat
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when cabinet door is confirmed open and robot has retreated

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the cabinet door is visible in the robot's sensors.
Scans workspace for cabinet door if not visible.
Detects and localizes the cabinet door.
Approaches and aligns robot arm to cabinet door.
Checks whether cabinet door is open.
Retreats arm to safe position after opening.

recovery_strategy: Visual re-scan and retry up to 3 times
Abort and retreat to safe position after repeated failure
assumptions: Instruction spelling 'carbinet' mapped to 'cabinet_door' in frames
Frame [0..8] clearly show door, arm, and open/closed states—door is hinged, not sliding.
No grasping is performed directly; only pushing/pulling opening actuation.
Cabinet door in frames matches instruction intent.

expected_success_criteria: Cabinet door visible and opened as seen in final frames
Robot arm safely retreats after actuation
